original: rta ni don yod grub pa rlung rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rta ni don yod grub pa rlung rdo rje ste /
translated: The horse is Amoghasiddhi, the wind-vajra.

original: de'i rus pa ni de'i 'od zer zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: de'i rus pa ni de'i 'od zer zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Its bone means its light ray.

original: bram ze'i rus pas dgug pa nyid /
analyzed: bram ze'i rus pas dgug pa nyid /
translated: One should summon with the bone of a brahmin.

original: bram ze'i rus pas zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis dgug pa'i yul la bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i rus pas zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis dgug pa'i yul la bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite with the rosary of the bone of a brahmin, that is, the bone of the Tathāgata family, in the place of summoning.

original: yang na @289a * //
analyzed: yang na @289a * //
translated: Or else,

original: gang bram ze'i rus pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas dgug pa sdud pa'o //🔽glang po'i rus pas char dbab pa /
analyzed: gang bram ze'i rus pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pas dgug pa sdud pa'o // glang po'i rus pas char dbab pa /
translated: one should summon, that is, gather, with the bone of a brahmin, that is, the realization of complete nirvāṇa.🔽One should bring rain with the bone of an elephant.

original: char dbab ba'i yul la glang po che'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: char dbab ba'i yul la glang po che'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One should recite with the rosary of elephant bone in the place of bringing rain.🔽Or else,

original: yang na gang /
analyzed: yang na gang /
translated: what?

original: char pa dbab pa zhes pa byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: char pa dbab pa zhes pa byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba ste /
translated: The “rain” is the arising of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: glang po che'i rus ba zhes pa 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa'i don yod grub pa'i ye shes kyis zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: glang po che'i rus ba zhes pa 'od dpag med dang dbyer med pa'i don yod grub pa'i ye shes kyis zhes pa'i don no //
translated: The “elephant bone” is the gnosis of Amoghasiddhi, inseparable from Amitābha.

original: ma he'i rus pas gsad pa'o //
analyzed: ma he'i rus pas gsad pa'o //
translated: “The buffalo bone” is the killing.

original: zhes pa gsad pa'i yul la ma he'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa gsad pa'i yul la ma he'i rus pa'i bgrang phreng gis bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: “With the rosary of buffalo bones” means that one should do the repetition with a rosary of buffalo bones in the place of killing.

original: yang na gang gsad pa zhes pa dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang gsad pa zhes pa dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Or else, “what is killed” is the nature of the complete purification of all the sense organs, sense objects, and consciousnesses.

original: ma he'i rus pa zhes pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid do //🔽rengs par 'o ma'i btung ba nyid /
analyzed: ma he'i rus pa zhes pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid do // rengs par 'o ma'i btung ba nyid /
translated: “The buffalo bone” is the nature of the gnosis of the ultimate realm.🔽“The milk drink” is the paralyzing.

original: rengs par byed pa'i dus na 'o ma'i btud ba bya'o //🔽dbang la rang gi 'dun pas spyad ;
analyzed: rengs par byed pa'i dus na 'o ma'i btud ba bya'o // dbang la rang gi 'dun pas spyad ;
translated: “At the time of paralyzing, one should drink milk.”🔽“In the magnetizing, one should practice with one’s own desire.”

original: / ces pa dbang gi bya ba la rang gi 'dun pas spyad de /
analyzed: / ces pa dbang gi bya ba la rang gi 'dun pas spyad de /
translated: “In the activity of magnetizing, one should practice with one’s own desire.”

original: ji ltar 'dod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice as one desires.

original: gsad pa la ni sih'a nyid //
analyzed: gsad pa la ni sih'a nyid //
translated: For killing, it is the lion itself.

original: ces pa sih'a nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa sih'a nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the lion itself.

original: dgug pa la ni gzhi mnyam ste /
analyzed: dgug pa la ni gzhi mnyam ste /
translated: For summoning, it is the same as the base.

original: sdang la sh'a linydza ru brjod //
analyzed: sdang la sh'a linydza ru brjod //
translated: For enraging, it is said to be śāliñja.

original: de bzhin skrod la gla rtsi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin skrod la gla rtsi'o //
translated: For banishing, it is likewise musk.

original: yang na / mtha'i shva dang / dang po'i shva dang / na dang po dang / ga dang po dang / ha dang po nyid kyang de bzhin nyid de gsungs pa'i sh'a linydza nyid ni na dang go dang so can rnams zhes pa'i don no //
analyzed: yang na / mtha'i shva dang / dang po'i shva dang / na dang po dang / ga dang po dang / ha dang po nyid kyang de bzhin nyid de gsungs pa'i sh'a linydza nyid ni na dang go dang so can rnams zhes pa'i don no //
translated: Or, the final śva, the first śva, the first na, the first ga, and the first ha itself are likewise. The śāliñja that is taught is the meaning of those with na, ga, and sa.

original: yang na / rengs par byed pa dang dbang du byed pa dang / gsad pa dang / dgug pa dang / dbye ba dang / bskrad pa ste las drug po 'di rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon dang / rdo rje sems dpa'i sa bon bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na / rengs par byed pa dang dbang du byed pa dang / gsad pa dang / dgug pa dang / dbye ba dang / bskrad pa ste las drug po 'di rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i sa bon dang / rdo rje sems dpa'i sa bon bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Or, for these six actions—paralyzing, enthralling, killing, summoning, separating, and banishing—one should meditate on the seed syllables of the five tathāgatas and the seed syllable of Vajrasattva.

original: de la 'o ma'i btung ba zhes pa byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de la 'o ma'i btung ba zhes pa byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: There, the “drink of milk” is bodhicitta.

original: rang gi 'dun pa zhes pa de 'byung ba na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi 'dun pa zhes pa de 'byung ba na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: When one's own desire arises, it is the nature of innate joy.

original: sih'a dang / gzhi mnyam dang sh'a linydza dang / gla rtsi rnams gsungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: sih'a dang / gzhi mnyam dang sh'a linydza dang / gla rtsi rnams gsungs pa nyid de /
translated: The three, namely, saffron, even ground, and śālinī, and musk are mentioned.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyi rol gyi yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / phyi rol gyi yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The inner nature is the purity of the eyes, etc., and the outer is the purity of form, etc.

original: mtha'i shva la sogs pa rnams ni gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtha'i shva la sogs pa rnams ni gnyis ka dbyer med pa nyid de /
translated: The śva, etc., at the end are the indivisibility of the two.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi @289b dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi @289b dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa kha sbyor 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa kha sbyor 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: The purity of the saṃbhogakāya is said to be the characteristic of the opening of the bhaga.

original: bzlas pa'i le'u bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i le'u bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth chapter of the Repeating.

original: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the tenth chapter of the second section of the Stainless Light commentary on the Hevajra Tantra called the “Opening of the Bhaga.”

original: // /'dis ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin sku gnyis bstan nas /
analyzed: // /'dis ni shin tu rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin sku gnyis bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the two bodies, which are the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhātu,

original: da ni lus can rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pas chos kyi sku dang dbyer med pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni lus can rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pas chos kyi sku dang dbyer med pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: now, in order to teach the nature of the five gnoses and three bodies, which are inseparable from the dharmakāya, he speaks with the statement of the characteristics of embodied beings.

original: kyee rdo rje la dam 'khyud cing /
analyzed: kyee rdo rje la dam 'khyud cing /
translated: Embracing Hevajra

original: tshems kyis ma mchu btsir nas ni //
analyzed: tshems kyis ma mchu btsir nas ni //
translated: and biting the lower lip with his teeth,

original: lus can rnams kyi rigs kyi gzugs //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi rigs kyi gzugs //
translated: the form of the family of embodied beings

original: de la bdag med mas zhus pa //
analyzed: de la bdag med mas zhus pa //
translated: is asked by Nairātmya.

original: dam du 'khyud pa nyid las kye'i rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: dam du 'khyud pa nyid las kye'i rdo rje nyid do //
translated: Embracing him closely is Hevajra.

original: tshems kyis ma mchu btsir nas ni //
analyzed: tshems kyis ma mchu btsir nas ni //
translated: Biting the lower lip with his teeth

original: zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kye'i rdo rje nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i rgyu nyid kyis kye'i rdo rje nyid do //
translated: is Hevajra by the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: skabs de la bdag med mas zhus pa /
analyzed: skabs de la bdag med mas zhus pa /
translated: In that context, Nairātmya asks,

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: “What is that?”

original: gsungs pa / lus can skye ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: gsungs pa / lus can skye ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyi gzugs te /
translated: He says, “The form of embodied beings, who are of the nature of birth.”

original: de ltar gyur pa'i kam ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i kam ye shes so //
translated: Such is the gnosis of kaṃ.

original: bha gar ling ga bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: bha gar ling ga bzhag nas ni //
translated: Having placed the linga in the bhaga,

original: 'khor lo'i 'dren pas 'di skad gsungs //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i 'dren pas 'di skad gsungs //
translated: the Leader of the Wheel spoke thus:

original: bha gar ling ga bzhag nas ni //
analyzed: bha gar ling ga bzhag nas ni //
translated: Having placed the linga in the bhaga,

original: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med par gyur pa na 'khor lo'i 'dren pas de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje 'chang dang bdag med ma dbyer med par gyur pa na 'khor lo'i 'dren pas de skad gsungs so //
translated: When Vajradhara and Nairātmya became inseparable, the Leader of the Wheel spoke thus.

original: lus can rang gi rigs bshad kyis //
analyzed: lus can rang gi rigs bshad kyis //
translated: Having explained the nature of the families of embodied beings,

original: shes rab pha rol phyin ma nyon //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin ma nyon //
translated: listen, Perfection of Wisdom!

original: lus can skye ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi rigs gang dang gang gi rigs gang yin pa de bshad cing brjod par bya yis kye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma nyon cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: lus can skye ba'i rang bzhin rnams kyi rang gi rigs gang dang gang gi rigs gang yin pa de bshad cing brjod par bya yis kye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma nyon cig ces pa'o //
translated: Having explained and described the nature of the families of embodied beings who are of such and such a family, listen, O Perfection of Wisdom!

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: bud med dam ni skyes pa yi //
analyzed: bud med dam ni skyes pa yi //
translated: Of a woman or a man,

original: gang gi ming med tsa ba la //
analyzed: gang gi ming med tsa ba la //
translated: whose nameless is

original: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse dgu par gyur pa //
translated: the nine-pointed vajra,

original: mi bskyod pa yi rigs mchog nyid //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa yi rigs mchog nyid //
translated: is the supreme family of Akṣobhya.

original: bud med lag pa g-yon pa'i ming med dang / skyes pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i ming med de /
analyzed: bud med lag pa g-yon pa'i ming med dang / skyes pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i ming med de /
translated: The nameless of a woman is the left hand, and the nameless of a man is the right hand.

original: de la gal te rdo rje rtse dgu pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de'i tshe skyes pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te rdo rje rtse dgu pa'i mtshan ma yod pa de'i tshe skyes pa mi bskyod pa'i rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sign of the nine-pointed vajra exists, then one is born into the family of Akṣobhya.

original: yang na / ming med ni bdag med ma ste //
analyzed: yang na / ming med ni bdag med ma ste //
translated: Again, the nameless is Nairātmya,

original: rtsa pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rtsa pa ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: and the root is Vajradhara.

original: gnyis ka'i ye shes su gyur pa na gang gi zhes pa ma ning ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i ye shes su gyur pa na gang gi zhes pa ma ning ste /
translated: When both become gnosis, the one who is called “the neuter”

original: bud med bdag med ma'am /
analyzed: bud med bdag med ma'am /
translated: is the woman Nairātmya,

original: skyes pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: or the man Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The gnosis of the indivisible vajra

original: rtse dgu ba @290a * //
analyzed: rtse dgu ba @290a * //
translated: is the nine-pointed one.

original: dgu'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the nine.

original: bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor dang rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor dang rdo rje 'chang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍala of Nairātmya and the maṇḍala of Vajradhara

original: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor de yang skabs dang gnas skabs so sor bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i dkyil 'khor de yang skabs dang gnas skabs so sor bstan pa nyid do //
translated: are the maṇḍala of the indivisibility of both, which is taught in each context and situation.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rigs mchog ces pa 'di gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rigs mchog ces pa 'di gtso bo nyid do //
translated: This “supreme family of Akṣobhya” is the principal one.

original: rnam snang mdzad kyi 'khor lor 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam snang mdzad kyi 'khor lor 'gyur //
translated: One becomes the wheel of Vairocana.

original: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi 'khor lo mtshan mar 'gyur ro //🔽dpag med mgo na gyi 'dam skyes nyid //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi 'khor lo mtshan mar 'gyur ro // dpag med mgo na gyi 'dam skyes nyid //
translated: This is the sign of the wheel for the family of Vairocana.

original: 'od dpag med kyi rigs kyi mtshan ma padmar 'gyur ro //🔽rin chen 'byung gi rin chen che /
analyzed: 'od dpag med kyi rigs kyi mtshan ma padmar 'gyur ro // rin chen 'byung gi rin chen che /
translated: The lotus is the sign of Amitābha.

original: rin po che'i rigs kyi mtshan ma rin po cher 'gyur ro ;🔽/ las kyi rigs kyi ral gri nyid //
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs kyi mtshan ma rin po cher 'gyur ro ; / las kyi rigs kyi ral gri nyid //
translated: The jewel is the sign of Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi mtshan ma ral grir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i rigs kyi mtshan ma ral grir 'gyur ro //
translated: The sword is the sign of Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'khor lo snang ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo snang ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The wheel is the purity of the light.

original: padma mngon par brjod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: padma mngon par brjod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The lotus is the purity of the expression.

original: rin po che yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rin po che yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The jewel is the nature of the intuition.

original: ral gri ni mi shes pa thams cad gcod pa nyid kyis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri ni mi shes pa thams cad gcod pa nyid kyis rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The sword is the result, the nature of the indivisibility of the three vajras, since it cuts off all ignorance.

original: rtse dgu pa rdo rje'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa'i rigs gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: rtse dgu pa rdo rje'i rang bzhin mi bskyod pa'i rigs gnyis ka mnyam pa nyid kyi mchog ste /
translated: The nine-pointed vajra is the nature of Akṣobhya, the supreme equality of the two.

original: rigs ma 'chol pa nyid kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'bad pa med pa nyid kyis mngon du 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ma 'chol pa nyid kyis phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'bad pa med pa nyid kyis mngon du 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: By not confusing the family, the spiritual power of the Great Seal will manifest without effort.

original: rang 'dod lha'i rigs kyis spyod pa bya zhes gang gsungs pa de shin tu nges pa'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod lha'i rigs kyis spyod pa bya zhes gang gsungs pa de shin tu nges pa'o //
translated: This is the definitive statement of the passage, “One should practice the conduct of the family of one’s desired deity.”

original: 'dis ni mtshan ma rnams par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan ma rnams par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gsungs pa'o //
translated: This passage explains the purification of the signs of the tathāgatas.

original: gzhan yang kha dog gi mtshan ma gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha dog gi mtshan ma gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, the signs of color are taught:

original: rnal 'byor pa gang nag po che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang nag po che //
translated: The yogin who is very dark

original: de yi lha ni mi bskyod pa //
analyzed: de yi lha ni mi bskyod pa //
translated: has Akṣobhya as his deity.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an example,

original: gnyis ka la yang mtshan ma 'di'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang mtshan ma 'di'o //
translated: for both have this sign.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar po che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar po che //
translated: The yogin who is very white

original: de yi lha ni rnam snang mdzad //
analyzed: de yi lha ni rnam snang mdzad //
translated: has Vairocana as his deity.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang sngo bsangs che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang sngo bsangs che //
translated: The yogin who is very dark blue

original: de yi lha ni don yod nyid //
analyzed: de yi lha ni don yod nyid //
translated: has Amoghasiddhi as his deity.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang ser po che //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang ser po che //
translated: The yogin who is very yellow

original: rin chen dbang po rigs kyi lha //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po rigs kyi lha //
translated: has Ratnasaṃbhava as his family deity.

original: rnal 'byor ba gang dmar ser nyid //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba gang dmar ser nyid //
translated: The yogin who is orange

original: 'od dpag med pa rigs kyi lha //
analyzed: 'od dpag med pa rigs kyi lha //
translated: Amitābha is the clan deity.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar dang ser //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang dkar dang ser //
translated: The yogi who is white and yellow

original: de ni sems dpa'i rigs su 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni sems dpa'i rigs su 'gyur //
translated: is of the bodhisattva clan.

original: 'dis ni nag po mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni nag po mi bskyod pa thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: By this, the black is Akṣobhya, the mind vajra.

original: dkar po rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'o //
translated: The white is Vairocana, the body vajra.

original: sngo bsangs don yod grub pa gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sngo bsangs don yod grub pa gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: The blue is Amoghasiddhi, the speech vajra.

original: gang yang ser po che bde ni rin chen dbang po @290b zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: gang yang ser po che bde ni rin chen dbang po @290b zhes pa rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: And the yellow is Ratnasaṃbhava, the jewel lord, who is Vajradhara, the indivisible three vajras.

original: rnal 'byor pa gang dmar ser zhes pa dmar po rin chen dbang po dang ser po 'od dpag med de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gang dmar ser zhes pa dmar po rin chen dbang po dang ser po 'od dpag med de /

original: steng dang 'og tu blta bar bya //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu blta bar bya //

analyzed: zhes pa steng 'og dang 'og steng du blta bar bya zhing nyams su myong ba'i sbyor bas mngon du bya'o //
translated: One should look above and below, and below and above, and realize them through the practice of experience.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result is stated:

original: dngos grub rgyas pa thob pa ste //
analyzed: dngos grub rgyas pa thob pa ste //
translated: One attains the expansion of power,

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam par 'gyur //

original: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas me long lta bu la sogs pa thams cad mnyam pa gnyis su med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: skad cig de la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig de la ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does that happen in that very moment?🔽It is stated:

original: gsungs pa / der ni ga pur btung bar bya //
analyzed: gsungs pa / der ni ga pur btung bar bya //

original: khyad par du yang chad nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par du yang chad nyid do //

original: der ni ga pur rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: der ni ga pur rgyu yi phyir //
translated: Because camphor is the cause there,

original: ba la bza' ba nyid du bya //
analyzed: ba la bza' ba nyid du bya //

original: ga pur btung ba zhes pa a'a li n'a da'i phreng ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ga pur btung ba zhes pa a'a li n'a da'i phreng ba blta bar bya'o //

original: khyad par du yang med na zhes pa a'a li 'byung ba nyid las k'a li yang 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par du yang med na zhes pa a'a li 'byung ba nyid las k'a li yang 'byung ba ste /
translated: In particular, if there is no ka, then a arises from a itself, and ka arises from a itself.

original: 'di nyid khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid khyad par ro //
translated: This is the particular [rule].

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma de na thugs rdo rje yang btung bar bya'o // der ni zhes pa /
translated: For that very reason, ma is also to be drunk, that is, ma is also to be consumed.🔽There, that is, in the state of the supreme secret, one should eat the meat of the body.

original: skad cig de la ba la bza' //
analyzed: skad cig de la ba la bza' //
translated: In that moment, one should eat the meat, that is, one should consume the body.

original: zhes pa sku'i mngon par zhen pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sku'i mngon par zhen pa yang med pa'o //
translated: There is also no clinging to the body.

original: de dag thams cad ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one do all of that?

original: rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: The stages are taught.

original: ga pur rgyu yi phyir zhes pa thams cad byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid las zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ga pur rgyu yi phyir zhes pa thams cad byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid las zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: For the sake of camphor, that is, for the sake of generating the bodhicitta, all is intended.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig ba'o //🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa nyid don te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u ste bcu gcig ba'o // lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa nyid don te /

original: don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'o //
translated: As for the practice of the meaning of coemergence, coemergence is the meaning, that is, the ultimate.

original: de yang sbyor ba zhes pa shes rab kyi mchod pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba zhes pa shes rab kyi mchod pa'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: le'u gang du de gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir lhan cig pa'i don gyi sbyor ba'i le'u'o //
translated: Since this is the chapter in which that is primary, it is the chapter on the practice of the meaning of coemergence.🔽The eleventh is the absence of coemergence, and since the ten are the nature of the nine by means of union, that is the meaning.

original: bcu gcig pa lhan cig med pa ste @292b aa dang bcu ni kha sbyor nyid kyis dgu'i bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes pa'i don no zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu gcig pa'o /

translated: This is the eleventh chapter of the commentary on the Two-Part Hevajra Tantra called “Stainless Light.”

original: // / da ni lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba le'u bcu gcig par mngon par gsal ba la /
analyzed: // / da ni lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor ba le'u bcu gcig par mngon par gsal ba la /
translated: Now, in the eleventh chapter, the practice of the meaning of coemergence is revealed.

original: de nas rdo rje can gyis dbang bzhi'i tshigs bcad bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje can gyis dbang bzhi'i tshigs bcad bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then Vajradhara spoke the verses of the four empowerments.

original: de nas rdo rje can rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje can rdo rje 'chang ste /
translated: Then Vajradhara is the holder of the vajra.

original: dbang bzhi ni /
analyzed: dbang bzhi ni /
translated: The four empowerments are

original: slob dpon gsang ba shes rab dang / bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gsang ba shes rab dang / bzhi pa de yang de bzhin no //
translated: the master, secret, wisdom, and the fourth empowerment.

original: zhes pa dbang bzhi ste //
analyzed: zhes pa dbang bzhi ste //
translated: These are the four empowerments.

original: gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba las ches shin tu gsang ba'o //

original: de rnams kyi tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /

original: rdo rje che dang dril bu che //
analyzed: rdo rje che dang dril bu che //
translated: The great vajra and the great bell,

original: rdo rje rab tu gnas pa bzung //
analyzed: rdo rje rab tu gnas pa bzung //
translated: holding the well-established vajra,

original: de ring rdo rje slob dpon gyur //
analyzed: de ring rdo rje slob dpon gyur //
translated: today you have become a vajra master.

original: slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis //
analyzed: slob ma bsdu ba nyid du gyis //

original: rdo rje che zhes pa kha sbyor kyi rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: rdo rje che zhes pa kha sbyor kyi rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa nyid de /

analyzed: 'di nyid dril bu che zhes pa 'di'i don yang ngo //

original: rdo rje mi phyad pa'i sku zung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyad pa'i sku zung zhes pa ste /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu gnas pa thams cad du so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is well established in every way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje slob dpon gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje slob dpon gyur /
translated: For that very reason, you have become a vajra master.

original: slob ma me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes kyi bsdu ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par gyis /
analyzed: slob ma me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyis ye shes kyi bsdu ba yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin sgrub par gyis /

analyzed: rdo rje chen po zung zhes pa slob dpon gyi dbang ngo ;
translated: The great vajra pair is the master initiation.

original: / dril bu che zhes pa gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: / dril bu che zhes pa gsang ba'i dbang ngo //

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Just as the buddhas of the past

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams dbang bskur ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams dbang bskur ba //

original: bdag gis gsang ba'i dbang gis ni //

original: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes kyi dbang gsungs pa'o //

original: lha mo dga' sbyin gnas sbyin ma //
analyzed: lha mo dga' sbyin gnas sbyin ma //

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid 'ong ma //

analyzed: khyer cig khyer cig sems dpa' che //

analyzed: lha mo zhes pa ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sna tshogs gzugs can te /

original: de nyid kyi phyir yid 'od ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yid 'od ma'o //

analyzed: zung shig zung shig ces pa shin tu brtan par gyis shig pa'o /

analyzed: kye sems dpa' chen po'i ye shes chen po'i ros yongs su gang ba'i sku //

analyzed: du brten par byas te /

original: mchod pa dag tu gyis //
analyzed: mchod pa dag tu gyis //

analyzed: gnyis ka dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa thob par gyis zhes pa dbang bzhi pa'o //

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: ches phra ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdul dang bral ba'o ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdul dang bral ba'o ;

analyzed: rang las gzhan pa 'ga' yang med /

analyzed: ces pa'o // 'di ni /
translated: This is the clarification of the meaning of

analyzed: / nam mkha' mtshungs pa gsum pa khyad par gyi dga' ba'o //

analyzed: rdul bral zhes ba bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //

analyzed: aom zhes pa rdo rje gsum mi phyed pa nyid gsungs pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir bi shva rdo rje 'chang ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bi shva rdo rje 'chang ste /

analyzed: de lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: aom zhes pa'i don bshad zin no ;
translated: The meaning of Oṃ has been explained.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir badzra ma h'a dve shva tsa tur a'a nanda d'a ya ka dga' ba bzhi'i kun tu rtog pa yongs su spangs ba'o //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir badzra ma h'a dve shva tsa tur a'a nanda d'a ya ka dga' ba bzhi'i kun tu rtog pa yongs su spangs ba'o //
translated: Therefore, Vajra Mahāveśa Caturānandadāyaka, having abandoned the conception of the four joys.

original: kha ga mu kha ae k'a ra so mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir kha ga sems te /
analyzed: kha ga mu kha ae k'a ra so mkha' la 'gro ba'i phyir kha ga sems te /
translated: Khagamukha Ekāra So, because of moving in the sky, khaga is mind.

original: de nyid au kha dang po'o //
analyzed: de nyid au kha dang po'o //
translated: That itself is the first u.

original: de nyid ae k'a ra so lhan cig ma yin pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ae k'a ra so lhan cig ma yin pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That itself is ekāra, having the characteristic of the experience of non-simultaneity.

original: n'a tha zhes pa 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
analyzed: n'a tha zhes pa 'gro ba'i bla ma ste /
translated: Nātha means “the guru of beings.”

original: de ni kye n'a tha zhes pa kun du bod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kye n'a tha zhes pa kun du bod pa'o //
translated: That is “O Nātha,” which is the exclamation.

original: h'um h'um k'a r+yam ku ru shva me zhes pa'i don brjod zin no //
analyzed: h'um h'um k'a r+yam ku ru shva me zhes pa'i don brjod zin no //
translated: The meaning of “Hum hum kāryaṃ kuru svāhā” has been explained.

original: rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags bsgrub pa'i dus na spyi bor aom yig ces pa smin ma'i dbus su bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo zla ba'i gdan la aom yig kha dog dkar po snying gar h'um yig ces pa snying gar chos kyi 'khor lor
analyzed: rdo rje dang padma byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags bsgrub pa'i dus na spyi bor aom yig ces pa smin ma'i dbus su bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo zla ba'i gdan la aom yig kha dog dkar po snying gar h'um yig ces pa snying gar chos kyi 'khor lor
translated: The mantra for the consecration of the vajra and lotus is: At the time of practice, the syllable Om is on the crown, that is, in the middle of the eyebrows, in the great bliss cakra, on a moon seat, the syllable Om, white in color. The syllable Hum is at the heart, that is, in the dharmacakra at the heart,

original: nyi ma'i gdan la h'um yig kha dog nag po'o //🔽ze'u 'bru la a'a: yig ces pa sbrul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su a'a: yig kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan la h'um yig kha dog nag po'o // ze'u 'bru la a'a: yig ces pa sbrul pa'i 'khor lo'i dbus su a'a: yig kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: on a sun seat, the syllable Hum, black in color.🔽The syllable Ah is on the pistil, that is, in the center of the emanation cakra, the syllable Ah, red in color.

original: rked pa'i mtshams su sv'a yig kha dog ser po'o //
analyzed: rked pa'i mtshams su sv'a yig kha dog ser po'o //
translated: The syllable Sva is at the waist, yellow in color.

original: brla zung la h'a yig kha dog ljang gu'o zhes pa bsams nas /
analyzed: brla zung la h'a yig kha dog ljang gu'o zhes pa bsams nas /
translated: The syllable Ha is on the two thighs, green in color.

original: aom a'a: h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa byin gyis brlab pa rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor ba na bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um sv'a h'a zhes pa byin gyis brlab pa rdo rje padma mnyam par sbyor ba na bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized that, one should practice the consecration with the mantra Om Ah Hum Sva Ha, when the vajra and lotus are united.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes pa sku gsum gyi rang bzhin sku gsung thugs so //
translated: Om Ah Hum is the nature of the three bodies, body, speech, and mind.

original: sv'a h'a zhes pa ye shes lnga ste /
analyzed: sv'a h'a zhes pa ye shes lnga ste /
translated: Sva Ha is the five intuitions.

original: sku gsum dang ye shes lnga po nyid dgu'i bdag nyid can yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kye'i rdo rje theg pa chen po gsang sngags kha sbyor 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sku gsum dang ye shes lnga po nyid dgu'i bdag nyid can yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid kye'i rdo rje theg pa chen po gsang sngags kha sbyor 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The three bodies and the five pristine awarenesses are the nature of the three syllables, which are the nature of Hevajra, the characteristic that opens the union of the secret mantra of the Great Vehicle.

original: sngags btubs sbrul ba'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sngags btubs sbrul ba'i sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The mantra is the nature of the emanation body.

original: sngags bzlas pas longs spyod pa'i sku'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pas longs spyod pa'i sku'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The recitation of the mantra is the nature of the enjoyment body.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor bas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no /🔽dbang @294a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i don gyi sbyor bas chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin no / dbang @294a * //
translated: The application of the meaning of the innate is the nature of the truth body.

original: bzhi pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i rang bzhin brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: The fourth initiation is the nature of the essential body.

original: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rdzogs so /
analyzed: brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rdzogs so /
translated: The king of tantras of Hevajra, which is the nature of the two examinations, has been extracted from the Thirty-Two Examinations.

original: // / brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: // / brtag pa sum cu rtsa gnyis pa las phyung ba brtag pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin kye'i rdo rje'i rgyud kyi rgyal po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The thirty-two chapters extracted from the Hevajra Tantra, the king of all tantras, which is the nature of omniscience and the nature of perfect enlightenment,

original: rdzogs so zhes pa kha sbyor gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa nyid ces pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs so zhes pa kha sbyor gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis thams cad la khyab pa nyid ces pa'o //
translated: are complete. This means that the nature of union pervades everything.

original: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: zhes pa kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa las brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twelfth chapter of the commentary on the Hevajra Tantra, the Stainless Light, which is the nature of union.

original: // / he ru ka ni zhal brgyad pa yi rim pa zung gis yongs khyab pa //
analyzed: // / he ru ka ni zhal brgyad pa yi rim pa zung gis yongs khyab pa //
translated: The eight-faced Heruka is pervaded by the pairs of stages,

original: grub pa kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa'i 'di ni rab brjod nas //🔽dge ba gang zhig bsags pa de yis kye yi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor las //
analyzed: grub pa kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med pa'i 'di ni rab brjod nas // dge ba gang zhig bsags pa de yis kye yi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor las //
translated: and this union of accomplishment, the Stainless Light, is well-explained.🔽By whatever virtue is accumulated from that, may all sentient beings

original: sems can thams cad srid pa rnam par dag pa'i dngos grub bstan gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad srid pa rnam par dag pa'i dngos grub bstan gyur cig /
translated: attain the siddhi of the pure existence of Hevajra yoga.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med ba zhes bya ba grub pa'i slob dpon chen po dham ka d'a shas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal kye'i rdo rje'i 'grel bshad kha sbyor shin tu dri ma med ba zhes bya ba grub pa'i slob dpon chen po dham ka d'a shas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Kalacakra Tantra, called the Stainless Light, composed by the great adept Dhamaka, is complete.

original: // / smin drug zla ba la ni pandi ta mchog dpal ldan chos kyi rgyal po'i bkas //
analyzed: // / smin drug zla ba la ni pandi ta mchog dpal ldan chos kyi rgyal po'i bkas //
translated: In the month of Karttika, by the order of the supreme pandita, the glorious king of the Dharma,

original: kye yi rdo rje'i 'grel bshad yon tan mchog ldan dham ka d'a shas mdzad pa ni //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje'i 'grel bshad yon tan mchog ldan dham ka d'a shas mdzad pa ni //
translated: the commentary on Hevajra, endowed with supreme qualities, composed by Dhamaka,🔽was translated here by the one born in the glorious land of Kashmir, called Vimalaprabha,

original: gang zhig dpal ldan kha che'i yul du 'khrungs pa dri med dpal zhes mtshan gsol dang // sthi ra ma ti'i rnam rgyas mdzes pa'i ngag gis 'dir ni legs par bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dpal ldan kha che'i yul du 'khrungs pa dri med dpal zhes mtshan gsol dang // sthi ra ma ti'i rnam rgyas mdzes pa'i ngag gis 'dir ni legs par bsgyur ba'o //
translated: with the beautiful words of Sthirapala.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan mtha' yas pa brnyes pa bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po'i bka' lung gis dpon zhang btsun gyis yon bdag byas te phyi dang nang gi gzhung lugs rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin pa kha che'i pandi ta
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan mtha' yas pa brnyes pa bla ma dam pa chos kyi rgyal po'i bka' lung gis dpon zhang btsun gyis yon bdag byas te phyi dang nang gi gzhung lugs rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin pa kha che'i pandi ta
translated: Vimalamitra, who has attained infinite common and uncommon qualities, was invited to Tibet by the benefactors Zhang and Tsün.

original: chen po bi ma la shr'i bha dra'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: chen po bi ma la shr'i bha dra'i zhal snga nas /
translated: He translated and taught the scriptures of the outer and inner systems, and reached the far shore of the ocean of treatises.

original: bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge srang blo brtan gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du legs par bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'i yi ge pa ni dge slong bsod nams dbang phyug ces bya ba'o /
analyzed: bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge srang blo brtan gyis dpal sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du legs par bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'i yi ge pa ni dge slong bsod nams dbang phyug ces bya ba'o /
translated: The Tibetan translator, Geshé Loden, translated this well in the glorious temple of Sakya, and it was edited and finalized. The scribe was the monk Sönam Wangchuk.

original: // / gang dang gang gis 'di la 'bad pa'i dge ba'i mthus //
analyzed: // / gang dang gang gis 'di la 'bad pa'i dge ba'i mthus //
translated: By the power of the virtue of whatever effort was made in this,🔽in all my lives, may I and all beings

original: skye ba skye bar skye bo'i tshogs pa mtha' dag gis //
analyzed: skye ba skye bar skye bo'i tshogs pa mtha' dag gis //
translated: completely and perfectly realize

original: 'di dang 'di lta'i rdo rje theg pa zab mo'i don //🔽kun nas kun du legs par rtogs shing rgyas par shog /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta'i rdo rje theg pa zab mo'i don //🔽kun nas kun du legs par rtogs shing rgyas par shog /
translated: the meaning of the profound Vajrayāna.
